Quality Control Technologist - Micro

Company Name International Flavors & Fragrances Company Location Dandenong, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

We are IFF. We are the catalyst for discoveries that spark the senses and transform the everyday. International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. is a leading innovator of sensorial experiences that move the world. At the heart of our company, we are fueled by a sense of discovery, constantly asking “what if?” That passion for exploration drives us to co-create unique scents and tastes in fine fragrances and beauty, detergents and household goods, as well as beloved foods and beverages.

Our 7,300 team members globally take advantage of leading consumer insights, research and development, creative expertise, and customer intimacy to develop differentiated products.

Dreamers and doers, we work tirelessly to discover flavors and fragrances that inspire customers and delight consumers. We are fueled by our four corporate values of passion, creativity, expertise and empowerment. It is the unique blend of these values that make us IFF. These qualities can be seen and felt throughout our amazing 129 year history and will continue to guide us as we explore our limitless possibilities and develop new-to-world solutions that enhance the lives of millions around the globe.

Please view our careers video at IFF Career Video- Great things are happening here

The History of IFF: The History of IFF
Follow us on social media: LinkedIn Facebook

The primary purpose of this position is to perform microbiological tests on raw materials and finished products and ensuring that they comply with IFF standards.

This is a 12 month fixed term full time position.

Required Skills
  • Perform microbiological tests on raw materials and finished products.
  • Ensure that all the required tests and media making is carried out in accordance with the procedures and techniques set out in the microbiological laboratory manual.
  • Ensure that all products meet specified quality requirements and to report all deviations to the Senior Microbiologist and Quality Manager.
  • Provide all QC test data accurately and consistently in a set timeframe to prevent any delays for production and customers.
  • Partake in sensory evaluation of products (all meats, seafood, alcohol, chemicals and sugar based materials).
  • Contribute in solving technical problems in relation to product specification, function, application and timeliness.
  • Provide technical support to the Senior Microbiologist and Quality Manager in internal audits and play an integral part in research and product improvement projects as per the GMP guidelines.
  • Perform assigned duties in a safe and responsible manner in accordance with company OHS policies.
  • Keep track of the inventory of consumables and prepare purchase requisition for lab, reagents and other consumables and negotiate purchase price for saving of funds.
  • Responsible for internal and external samples.
  • Maintain microbiological test data.
  • Maintain a clean and efficient microbiological laboratory environment and adhere to Good Laboratory Practices.
  • Provide backup for the QC team.
Required Experience
  • Minimum 2 years experience in microbiology lab
  • Minimum 1 year experience in food industry


Preferred Experience
  • Honours/Master degree in Microbiology, Biology, Food Science or Food Technology
  • Understanding of dry blending, liquids, spray dry and reaction flavour manufacturing processes and ingredients
  • Knowledgeable in food safety, raw materials, food regulations, sanitation and production processes
  • Proficient in MS Office
  • Working knowledge of SAP

Industry

  • Chemicals
  • Consumer Goods
  • Luxury Goods & Jewelry

Employment Type

Temporary

Job Functions

  • Other

Job description


Internal Communications Specialist


Summary

  • Be a highly visible voice across the business
  • Market an impressive EVP and benefits program


The Organisation


Our client is an Australian professional services organisation that has grown from strength to strength from starting as an Insurance Indemnity organisation. The business is going through an exciting period of growth and is looking for an Internal Communications Lead.


The Opportunity


The Internal Communications specialist will sit within People & Culture but will have strong links with both the wider Marketing team and Senior Leadership. The incumbent will be required to be hands-on in the delivery of internal communications activities, campaigns and content generation, while maintaining a strategic outlook.


This includes;

  • Implementing internal communications strategy and continually evaluating and improving internal communication activities;
  • Working with members of the Executive to assist in the communication of complex issues and strategic information;
  • Building internal communications capability within each Business area through the provision of advice, support and resources including the creation of corporate videos from start to finish.


To Be Successful

  • Proven experience in the development, delivery and evaluation of internal communications strategies;
  • Experience and demonstrated ability in writing and producing communications across various platforms including online, e-newsletters, publications, presentations, and video, and working with relevant suppliers.
  • Experience working directly with Executive Leadership and the provision of strategic internal communications advice.
  • Exposure to and understanding of working within an organisation with multiple businesses/ functions, and multiple office locations.


This role has room and flexibility for the successful incumbent to shape and grow it whilst being supported organisation-wide. If you have the skills and a great attitude, we'd love to hear from you!




For prompt consideration "apply now" or for a confidential discussion, please contact Chloe Sharpin at Think Talent on 0408 276 170.

Job description

Document Manager - Asset Management

The Royal Childrens Hospital

About Spotless

Spotless is a great Australian success story.

With a staff force of 36,000, we provide integrated facility management services that create added efficiencies for businesses everywhere. You’ll find us in diverse locations from airline lounges and major sporting venues, to city offices and army barracks. We have a strong presence all around Australia and New Zealand and we are proud of our people and our achievements.

If you are looking to make a positive career move, Spotless is a great choice for you.

The Role

Spotless, Australia and New Zealand's leading facility management service has a unique opportunity for an Asset Management Document Manager to join our team in the Royal Children’s Hospital. This sector is one of the fastest growing in Australia and Spotless is proudly leading the way in service delivery to it.

With a commitment to excellence and a personable approach to business, you will be responsible for the coordination of documentation for building and facilities asset operations. You will be a self-starter with proven initiative and the ability to prioritise tasks. You can work autonomously and pride yourself on meeting deadlines. You have strong analytical skills, communication skills and inter-personal skills and are confident in engaging and influencing stakeholders at all levels.

Your understanding of the legislative requirements and compliance obligations and how to manage them effectively as well as your knowledge of the challenges of record management and document control will ensure your success in this role.

You will be responsible for following all document control processes and procedures. Maintaining the various project registers and record and transmit incoming and outgoing documentation. You will also assist with reporting.

To excel in this key role within the Spotless Asset management team, you will have:
  • Applicants must have experience in Building or Facilities Management
  • Auto CAD intermediate to expert competency
  • Intermediate to expert use of Cloud share
  • Engineering configuration management experience
  • Continuous improvement focus
  • Excellent communication skills
  • A demonstrated commitment to customer and client experience
  • The right to work in Australia, or a pathway to obtain a suitable visa


Benefits And Culture
  • Supportive and inclusive culture
  • A professional and safe working environment
  • Good employee benefits and entitlements
  • Extremely flexible working arrangement
  • Competitive remuneration package

If this sounds like the role for you, then please apply online by clicking the ‘apply’ button below.

Job Number: 558248

Please note: As a pre-requisite for these roles candidates will be required to undertake a pre-employment medical and drug screen as well as a Working With Children Check and National Police Clearance.

Spotless is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion and encourages Indigenous Australians and Torres Strait Islanders and people of culturally diverse back grounds to apply.

835914058:
[

Creative Director

Company Name The Urban List Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 160 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Urban List

If it’s fun, fresh and cool, it’s The Urban List. We have grown to become Australia’s largest youth-focused media brand, connecting with over 1.5million people each month.

\xa0

At the Urban List, we create, imagine and inspire urban lifestyles, connecting the youth of Australia with the experiences, brands and cities we love.

\xa0

Our people are the dreamers, the seekers, the innovators and the believers. Those who want to live their best lives, explore beyond what they know, live on social media, and share this experience with the world. Sound good? Come join us!

\xa0

About the job

This position sits within the newly formed Marketing Team, responsible for building our brand equity through innovative, dynamic and impactful visual storytelling. We are looking for a Creative Director to develop, guide and embed our brand expression through our highly engaged channels and content formats. We have strong ambitions to build our brand, and now require a kick-ass creative director to help take us to our next phase of growth.

\xa0

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


\xa0Along with being at the forefront of culture and everything that is cool, you will be responsible for…

\xa0

  • Brand Identity and Art Direction: Developing and executing the visual identity for the brand across content format and channel (including partner campaigns), building the unique visual expression of our brand to drive saliency, impact and meaning
  • Visual Storytelling: Partnering with internal stakeholders within Marketing, Content, and Commercial to develop innovative creative concepts and creative direction of channels – both digital (e.g. site, socials, EDM), with partners, and offline (e.g. events)
  • Brand Custodianship: Act as a custodian of the brand to develop and enforce strong style guides-the use of typefaces, logo, grids, colours, talent, art direction etc.
  • Campaign Creation: Leading the creation of campaign materials to bring to life our brand strategy on our channels and beyond
  • Talent: Acting as the lead for talent identification, sourcing, negotiation, styling and art direction
  • Shoots: Leading the briefing process, art direction and attending as needed for our campaigns and those of our brand partners.
  • Relationship Building: Building and maintaining contacts and networks in artistic and cultural fields, including freelance designers, videographers and photographers.
  • Coaching and Team Management: Review resource, build capability, and develop specialist team as required
  • Suppliers: Reviewing suppliers and costings, identifying and building roster, developing rate cards, on-boarding, and processes

\xa0

\xa0

KEY REQUIREMENTS


  • Min 7 years experience as a creative lead – strong preference for a background of in-house Art Direction with youth brand(s) that encompasses digital, interactive brand and content design
  • Experience in fashion, lifestyle media, or apparel e-commerce a must
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Communication/ Graphic Design or equivalent
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite
  • At least 5 years experience leading a creative team
  • Strong portfolio that includes graphic design, photo and video art direction for youth brand(s) with a focus on digital and social
  • Deep understanding of cultural trends and impact on creative direction
  • On-set shoot experience
  • Experience identifying, selecting and styling talent in the fashion/apparel industry preferred
  • Experience in a fast-paced environment with sharp attention to detail



TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT

\xa0

Full Time with 6 months probation period


APPLICATION PROCESS


Please send your CV, cover letter and examples of work showcasing your creative and strategic portfolio to hr@theurbanlist.com.

\xa0

We receive a high volume of applications for our roles so we'll only be responding to those who have been shortlisted for interview.

\xa0

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Online Media

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Advertising
  • Strategy/Planning
  • Marketing

Job description

We are currently seeking Customer Retention and Sales Consultants on a permanent basis. This role is perfect for those who are looking for development opportunities and further up skill themselves within the customer retention space.

Our client is a leading Advertising and Marketing brand in Australia based in the CBD. You will get the chance to work with a fantastic working culture that is supportive of career growth and providing opportunities in a fast-moving environment.

With a strong focus on retaining revenue, you will be interacting with existing customers expressing a desire to cancel their services across our client’s broad range of print and digital marketing/advertising solutions. You will demonstrate a high level of adaptability and ability to deal with a variety of objections due to customer dissatisfaction. You will also be seeking opportunity to understand the client’s needs and offering them tailor made solutions for their business, resulting in sales.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Team Leader, your responsibilities will include but not limited to:
  • Responding to customer requests to downgrade or cancel their products and services
  • Maximising cross sell, up sell and solution selling opportunities on every call
  • Embracing solution selling techniques to maintain and increase customer yield
  • Take ownership of customer escalations and follow through with customer resolutions
  • Maintain a high level of customer administration for all activities
  • Attend regular training session to learn more about new and existing products as well as selling techniques.
  • Provide quality customer service to all clients and respond to customer contacts within 24 hours.
  • Diagnose customers’ needs and provide value adding solutions


Requirements
  • Full working rights
  • Proficiency in computer and call centre systems - Salesforce or other large ERP systems highly regarded
  • Time management/organisation track record
  • Ability to perform in a high-volume environment
  • Needs base sales and understanding the sales cycle and methodology
  • Proven track record in a sales or retention call centre environment 2+ years
  • Experience in meeting and exceeding sales targets
  • Digital marketing & advertising background
  • Outgoing and bubbly individual
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Adaptability and strong level of tolerance

What is in it for you?
  • Rotating roster between 9-6pm and NO weekends
  • Competitive base salary with uncapped commissions, and a generous rewards and incentives scheme
  • Working for a reputable brand and Australia’s biggest marketing company
  • Supportive environment and high performing team culture


How To Apply

For more information, you can call Georgia OLoughlin in our Melbourne office on (03) 9918 0951 quoting Job Reference 508245 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest.

Full-time

Job Category

Job Details

The Principal Solution Engineer is responsible for presenting a broad range of Salesforce solutions to prospects and customers while handling all technical objections in the sales cycle. Through carefully planned discovery with a range of stakeholders you will uncover the specific business requirements and value drivers that make this a compelling and transformative project. Working with the extended sales team you will help to develop a differentiated solution, demonstrate this to the customer, and address any questions and concerns they may have. During this process you will create impactful relationships with your customers and strive to become their trusted advisor.

What’s In It For You
  • Structured on-boarding and training program including boot camp in San Francisco
  • Outstanding benefits package including Comprehensive Health Insurance, employee stock plan, wellness reimbursement, company iPhone and iPad
  • Fantastic office facilities in Sydney CBD
  • Flexible work environment
  • Clear pathways for career development.

Specific Responsibilities
  • Work with medium size organisations across a range of industries to understand their challenges and goals through focused discovery sessions and workshops
  • Build and present customised product demonstrations
  • Confidently present and articulate the business value of your proposed solution to business managers and executives
  • Be an innovator who can create new solutions using out-of-the-box thinking
  • Work as a team player by contributing, learning and sharing new knowledge
  • Manage multiple customer engagements concurrently
  • Present at marketing events
  • Training and enablement of the sales team
  • Be self motivated, flexible, and proactive
  • Willingness and flexibility to travel as needed.

Required Skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills with a focus on capturing requirements and use cases, developing a solution and articulating business value
  • Superior presentation and demonstration skills with a focus on storytelling
  • Ability to work as part of a team to solve business and technical problems
  • Experience of working across a range of industries and be able to understand the current landscape and typical challenges and opportunities.

Preferred Skills
  • Experience in a comparable pre-sales position, supporting the sales cycle in selling CRM or other high value business solutions
  • Technical understanding of SAAS solutions, architecture and modern business applications including integrations
  • A broad understanding of Cloud Computing and CRM
  • Experience in multi product solution selling
  • Business Analysis and Business case/ROI construction
  • Detailed knowledge of Salesforce platform.

About Us

Salesforce.com is the global leader in customer relationship management (CRM) software. We pioneered the shift to cloud computing, and today we’re delivering the next generation of social, mobile and cloud technologies that help companies revolutionize the way they sell, service, market and innovate–and become customer companies. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes and #4 on BRWs Best Places to Work Australia list. Our more human, less corporate culture is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success. Ready to find your #dreamjob?
